intro: Hypericum macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered St. John's wort, is a shrub native to North America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and woody stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy yellow-orange flowers with five petals, which bloom in late summer.
